Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: joins the room

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: joins the room

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: joins the room

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: joins the room

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: leaves the room

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: joins the room

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: joins the room

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: so, we are all here. welcome team

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Hello everyone!

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: Hello!

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: hello

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: hey team

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: are we all ready ?

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: What do we have in schedule for today?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I see that our company has been very successful this year, but in order to keep our position we have to use better technologies for everyday tasks and communication

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we'll have to establish the technologies we will use from now on, so, where do we start?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: fair enough

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: there are many things we can consider: wikis, google wave, forums, blogs, chat and many more

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Let's begin with the description of our project

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: well, our software company has produced many applications for mobile phones and other mobile devices. so far we have many satisfied customers and employees, but we need more

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: ok, so basicly we need to add some ways for our emplyess to comunicate better, in order to increase our productivity

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: exactly, one of the essential things we need is good collaboration between our staff members, and that includes everything from chit-chat to technical details

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ok and in order to do this we need to use the best technologies.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and to improve our customer service support

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: You are all right

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I propose to start by talking about the chat

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i agree

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: What can you say about this Ileana?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: ok. that is indeed essentail

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: it is a good techonolgy to obtain a real time conversation between out employees, this way they could decide and colaborate together easier

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i think the chat application is essential actualy

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: but it's hard to keep a history

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: and due to the numerous chat programs, it shouldn't cost us anything to implement

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes you are right and we can use it for fast communication between our staff

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we could provide a chat with more rooms, including a global one for the entire company, and also more rooms for different departments

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: but not the "room" type, we need an instant messaging app. used fo 1on1

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: not necessarily, if we use a smart chat program that saves our logs and then we store them in a database

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we could have both

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I propose to use Skype for this. It is very profi :)

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: the issues that need to be considered here are speed and security

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: well.. i dont know about that dragos

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i mean, we should develop our own softwer

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: yes, and the database could be accessed by member using theyr id and password. this way we provide security also

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: that's my oppinion though

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I agree. that way we can have complete control of the application and upgrade it as we see fit

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I think it is not a good point because that takes a lot of time to develop and there are many tools to do this

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and we dont depend on other servers than our own

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: i agree with andrei, we should implement only what we need for chat

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: skype could be annoying if everybody starts talking in a department

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: well, a lot of time or not, it is important to be in complete control

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: the skype servers could fail at some point, or they could be experiencing lag issues

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: we must not have to deal with that kind of problems

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: since we have many talented engineers and programmers we can easily take what is good from other chat programs and add to our own

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I agree

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree to with this point of view, but time is also important for us

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Why not use something that is available

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: We should give our employees privileges, and they will be able to make private / public chat rooms, invite others to chat, create conferences, use voice over IP, most things that a good chat program offers

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: it is, indeed, but we could spare a little time to make a good product that would be specific for our needs

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: like ?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: well, that may be, but in let's say, a year, we will wish we had spent a bit more time on a more reliable application

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: what would you suggest we use that would offer all the advantages we need

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Like any other chat programme: GTalk,Skype even messanger. They all have what you mentioned befonre

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: and they are relaible too

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We do not want to invent the weel when someone allready done it

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we could also concern about their policy, a chat like that would not be totally private to us

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I don't think being dependant on other servers is such a good idea. besides there are known flaws when it comes to security: for example how can you be truly invisible

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree with you. You will never see these servers down

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but we wouldn't reinvent it actually, but adapt it

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: also, remember about privacy, if we develop our own chat, we can use it only in LAN, and then we can encript the communication between LANs as we see fit

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: privacy and information

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I totally agree with that suggestion

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: security*

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: and you have to admit yahoo and google accounts can be hacked in numerous ways

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: you would be putting our clients' information at risk

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: You cannot intercept for example Yahoo chat conversation I've tryed it and it doesn't work

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: there are other better hackers out there :), and, like I said, an account can easily be hacked

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: plus, it's better to make our chat because we can create our own specific rooms, rooms that aren't available in an application like skype

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: we could implement other technologies that are more usefull then chat

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but yahoo can

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: exactly

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: What do you suggest Flavius?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: also think about other problems that come with public chat applications, like spamming flooding and such

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: useful for what?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and also, we should have complete control on who our emplyees are able to talk to

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: for our company

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: The best thing to do, considering our elaborate employee database, is to create a chat program implementing the most common technologies that would be used internally

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: We can easily asses the costs and advantages and make a decision

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree with you on security, but on a chat you do not give top secret information.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: yes, and if we have time problems, we could offer a bonus for the employees that stay over time and implement that chat application

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can use it to announce events, meetings, tasks etc

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: well, top secret... is a bit.. dramatic, but there may be some sensitive data

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: sometimes you do, that's why security is important

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: if a chat program is well made, that will not be an issue. that's why we need to make our own program

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: and there are many other ways to do that :)

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but employees could use it to colaborate on different projects etc, this would be bad if the source codes would be given to other companyes

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: all in all, there are lots of downsides to public chatting apps. you have spam, flood, employees may get distracted easily, lower security,

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ok if you want to use this application in this scope we can make an internal one, but I mentioned earlier we have to think about time. A good and stable application takes time and our clients do not want us to waste it

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that problem is common in our field, but we have smart security measures at the office that prevent employees from doing that

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: like i said earlier, we could find a way to deal with time

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: how else do you think we have stayed in business :)

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: For this part I suggest something better like Goggle Wave or a SVN

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: chat would be excellent for meeting, discussion and other such topics, but we need more. We have to admit that, since we use a lot of different technologies and even create our own programs, we need a good way to keep them organized. a wiki is ideal for this

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: or better yet, if time is a problem, we could simply buy such an app

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: true, but if we would use a public application, like messenger, that would be a security breach

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: project can be created with wave and the technology behind them can be documented in a wiki

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree with you on this. Good idea!

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that's why our own chat program is the best idea

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Let's go on what Andrei suggested

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: ok, so do we all agree to make our own chat application?

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: guess not :))

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: we will assess the costs. it may be better if we develop it ourselves cause we will have complete control over the code

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: then again, if time is truly a problem, we can buy on and update that

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: that is not a problem, if we decide to buy software, there are lots of companies that specialise in creating custom apps, that meet specific requirements

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: you mentioned wave for our projects

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and i don't think time would be such a big problem, because we don't have to develop a complicated application

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: so we can get pretty much anything we need

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: do you think it can offer us everything we need for our many different departments

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes Constantin. Because we talked about internal communication, now let's talk about sharing code, documents etc

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: well, yes, because they work based on our specifications

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: I think that a program like wave will give us an advantege because we can use it and olso sell it

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: For thos we need an application like Google Wave that does all these things for us.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but before we do that, let's establish what are we going to do with chat, are we going to buy it or develop it ourselves? i say we make it, who else does?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: there are many ways to do that. google wave is indeed good for code and document sharing, and with a good wiki behind it where all the raw technical general data will be documented, our employees will be well organized

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: we could develop it ourselves, after all time is not such a big issue in this matter, our company worked well enough without a chat so far, it can go on for a bit longer without one

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes we can use both for Specifications, tasks, schedules etc

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: We will assess the situation. If time is short we will buy an application and then upgrade it when need arises. If we have time we will develop it ourselves

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: fair enough

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree with you on this

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that is excellent for our needs. is there an upload limit, as in a limit to the information we can put on their servers?

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: ok

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: No, the guys at Google are very generous with this stuff and is practically no limit

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: what about security problems?

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: And I think that goes the same for wikis

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Every user has an account and you can make a wave public only to a part of them. We do not need the HR to know what the Dev Department is doing

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: very well. and, is there a way to provide authentication for certain documents etc? some employees shouldn't be able to see all that's been shared

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: exactly. a wiki is perfect for our technical needs. also, they provide a good way to keep our information organized and give us excellent security, cause we can decide who can and can't see the different articles

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and that answers my question :P

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: ok, what about real time?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I'm guessing we use google accounts ?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: what exactly do you plan on using wikis for ?

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i was thinking they could be usefull for sharing information with the public

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: like maybe having tutorials, specification, and things like that published

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: You are right. You can make one for every user and it is free

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: this goes better on a blog

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: could they be a way to share/ technical documentation for our employees?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: we use a lot of different technologies and even create some of our own. a wiki would be an excellent way to gather them all in one place. that way our employees will have a great online database to check whenever they have a problem

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i agree with you on this

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that is excellent. and I'm guessing, since Google made it, the interface is smartly made and our employees will adjust to it easily

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i think that would be a bit confusing... after all, we have the technical department for issues like that

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ok let's make a review now.

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We will use waves for tasks, meetings, schedules etc

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: it is rather pointless for our staff to keep going to the technical department for most issues that they could look up for themselves, if they had a wiki

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: if an employee need to access some documentation on an earlier release of a product, he shouldn't have to go to the technical department to solve it

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: can we also use it to plan our projects ?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: the documentation is available in the databases

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: exactly

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I suggest a wiki is good for documentation and requirements of projects

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: should he need et, he only has to open it

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i highly disagree

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: not all of it. besides it is a lot easier to search a wiki then a database

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and also for technicals debates between employees

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Of course we can use it

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: wikis, by deffinition, are made for public wide use

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: all major companies have wikis for their technologies. most people like to search wikis cause they provide accurate and easy to access information. Also, that way our database servers won't be so used

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: You are wrong here, Costa can tell us more

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: yes, they have wikis that are publicly available, with public information, for the everyday user that takes an intrest in that company's products

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: not necessarily. we can restrict access to certain articles. that way our wiki will have some sections for the general public who want to find out some details about our technologies (what we are willing to share, of course) and some just for our employees

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: then we could have to types of wikis, public and private

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: our employees need not read articles, they need a quick way to get to certain documents

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can use a wweb site or a blog for doing that Andrei.

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: besides there is no way that you can structure a database to make information easier to access that a wiki

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: i agree with you and we also can post news or updates for our proucts

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: A wiki is not good for our clients. We need something with richer content, more attractive....

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: this way, we can interact with our customers, see what they think of our products, what they like and what they need

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: We can include that information in a wiki too. but I agree with Dragos's suggestion. Besides, the main purpose of our wiki would be to include technical details

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Can we customize a blog to make it look very nice ?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: That would be excellent. Having up to date information is the hallmark of a successful company

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Exactly, only tehnical information for our emplyees

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: I think we should use wiki for us and a blog for customers

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: what kind of techincal information are you refering to ?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: A blog or web-site is idea for day to day clients, the wiki can be accessed for those who want to find out more technical information about our company. sort of like application developers for Iphone want to find out more information about IOS

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: exactly !

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: everything from the technologies we use to those we implement. products and components, software programs, you name it

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: yup

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: that is what i have been saying this whole time

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: For example our projects need requirements that we receive from our clients. The developers need to have fast access to it as well as the QA to test if these requirements are implemented

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: we can't we just handle those requirements directly to the employees working on that project ?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: That raises another problem. We need a way for the customers to contact us easily

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and one other thing, we will definetely need an internal mailing client

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but we also need to find out what customers need and want

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: It is not a good point, because requirements change in time. There are added more or deleted.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: a blog is friendly and a good interface for the public

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can use a google wave to keep track of them. What do you say team?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: indeed. and so many people are used to them, it will be good for our clients

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: by the way, our site will definetely need some king of forum

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: That would be excellent. That way they wouldn't take up extra space on our servers.

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: best way to keep track of the clients needs / complains

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: definitely

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: That is what I suggested before

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: a forum could be very usefull for our technical support team

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: also, our technical support team will be able to offer quick solutions to any problem people might have

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Correct

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: we could also make a forum for customers, one only for paying clients where we could solve their problems and one for the staff members

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and we could also include a chat for that, if a client has more complex problems, he could be able to talk to one of our support technicians for solving it

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i dont think it's so important to have one for staff members, since they will have the chat and mail to communicate to each other

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: and many people find over 50% of the answers they seek on different forums

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Why should we use a forum for our stuff? We use a chat for that.

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that may be true

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: we can have somebody to answer their problems 24/7

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i dont think its necesary, if they have more complex problems, we have custommer support service via phone

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: indeed. that would indeed give the company a very good reputation

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes and we can use a forum for that. The problems will be very organized and if someone has the same problem he will just have to search for it

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but sometimes phone could be expensive, think of our customers from other countryes

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: but i don't think a forum is needed for our staff

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: but still, although answering problems by phone is good, having a support team ready 24/7 (with different people depending on the time interval of course) is a good idea

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: after seeing your arguments I totally agree.

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: yes, i just dont think a chat for this is highly needed

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: most likely, a simple forum will do just fine

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: if it's not highly needed, it sure looks good on us

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: it's always good to give people more alternatives

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: like Ileana said, it may be useful for customers from other countries. But still, a forum is a must. After all, that way problems that require some time to solve will never be forgotten; and the customer will know where to expect the answer

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: and the information will be well structured for other use

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: but think of another problem, what if it gets over-used, how many people will we need to stay chatting? think that we have milions of custommers

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: also it would spare some people time and money, if they search for their problem instead of calling already

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Like I said, a forums is excellent for solving problems, cause that way a customer who has had a similar problems will find the result easily.

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: we need something that can help our techincal support team answer as fast as they can, but a chat will require them to answer on the spot ! and if they are not available.. there goes our image down

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes that is what I have suggested. A chat 24/7 needs more stuff and more money

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: its just an unnecesary risk

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: but having a chat option in which a limited number of customers could have live chats with our staff regarding technical problems isn't impossible

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: precisely

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: this is true

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we won't need that many, probably most of the solutions a slient needs can be found in the forum, but for some exceptions, the chat could provide the rest of the support

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: quite

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: a simple forum, a contact phone number, and an email will sufice i belive

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: evreybody will ask on the chat because it will be easier

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: all major companies have that and it is indeed sufice

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: but there will be a waiting queue, of course, so many will prefer the forums

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Good point. I have never seen tech support on a chat.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and we could also have a way to tell the clients how may technicians are available

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: yea, people are so lazy, if they can do something to avoid searching on a forum, or waiting for a response on the mail.. they will do that

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: it's way better with just forum and phone

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and cheaper than phone

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: and of the wiki is smartly made, some of the more experienced users (not necessarily customers but developers) would also find information there

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: fair enough

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but, it's also easier to look in forum before chat

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: indeed, but just a contact email for business opportunities for example is ok

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes we can add a Q&A section on the wiki.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: it could be like that policy on forums, if a topic is already open on this debate, nobody will answer... that works with chat too, if the problem has a solution on forum, nobody will answer in chat

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: but still, you will need people to check the chat

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and im sure, there will be milions of requests to check

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ileana do you agree that a chat is not a good idea?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: an excellent idea, and if a problem if very common we will just highlight a certain thread, or pin it as it is called

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: well, our soft could do that for them, it could search the forum topics and see if the chat topic matches any of them

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: maybe not millions, give our programmers more credit :)

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: but the user will whait for the answer and will get mad whent he won't get it and we can lose this customer

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: than it would be more like a search engine. and the forum will already have one

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: ow well... since nobody wants it ... i won't insist anymore

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: exactly

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Why use a chat topic? We can use a forum topic. In a forum other users can answer to similar problems and get answers

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I agree. a good search engine is the key to success, wheatear we are talking about a forums, blog, database, wiki or even web-site

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: having a chat, is making a promise, that they will get a quick answer. and if we cant do that, it will look bad. better not to take the risk

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: ok then, maybe discuss it in a future conference? :)

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that depends, if we have a queue and the customer will see the number of people in front of him, he will estimate what to do

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: we all agree that for the moment the forum is the best way to solve problemes

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes and all the arguments are in favour

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Yes, and a blog + web-site the best way to give customers up-to-date information

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i didn't say we shouldn't have a forum, i totally agree that is the basic solution for this

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i just think that if we already consider a chat for our employees, why not for our customers too?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: we will use wave and wiki for "project management" and technical details

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: a google wave for internal meetings and tasks

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: and we will have a chat program for our employees to use inside the company

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and also remember we will need an internal mailing client

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and a forum for technical support

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: we could incorporate that in the chat application, or have an independent one

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: but i suggest incorporating it with the chat, it makes for easier use i think

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: But what about security policies. We need to establish clear policies about user accounts. Having a lot of applications will require a lot of accounts from each and every employee

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Outlook is a great tool for emails

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: dragos, you have to agree that any self-respected company has their own internal mailing client

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Indeed and if we buy many licenses we will get an advantageous discount

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can use the same user names+passwords for all of these applications.

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we should also have a way to control what emails can go out of the company

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: thats why internal mail is good

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: You are wronh here mail server not client

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we don't want important documents to be sold to the competition

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: no company related information can be sent outside

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Correct

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: ahh, ok

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: On one hand that is a terrific idea cause our staff won't be overwhelmed with data to remember yet on the other hand having one password for all these accounts is a security risk

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: not if we change it weekly or somting like that

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i don't think our smart and good employees will have problems remembering their passwords

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: We should at least make it compulsory to change passwords every month or so

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: yes, that is a great idea

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I was thinking at the same thing

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: oh sorry. you took the words out of my mouth :D

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and also force them to use special characters and digits too

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: great idea

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: exactly

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ileana the user is the weekest link in security

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: haha, true

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: true, but if they can't remember a password, they can find it by asking the tech guys

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that reminds me, we need administers for all the new technologies

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: the network administrators can do that

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: The IT department will take care of that

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: we can use a person or a team of people to handle the wiki posts, forums posts, wave documents and all the other important stuff

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: the only problem that still remains is that we need someone to check wiki articles, blog and forums posts so that classified data does not accidentally reach a "public" area

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: and another team for internel comuniction and security

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can use filters for that firewalls. That can save some money

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: saving money is always an excellent idea :)

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but how can you use a filter for a forum?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: well, mainly the tech dept. guys will do that, and i think we can count on them knowing what they are doing

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i dont think they will accidentaly post source codes :)

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can add a database of private key words that do not have to go to the customers.

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: besides reading the posts, we can have restricted key-words (we can check our database and forbid staff members from posting certain data)

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: once again someone beat me to the punch :D

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: that could prove a bit tricky, since it could get a bit to restrictive

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: but i think it can be done

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: It depends on the planning

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: yes, and also, if someone sells us out, he goes to jail :P

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: although this may seem a cliche, it is better to be restrictive then over permissive :D

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: yes

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: or worse, he will get fired :D

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Exactly

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Apart from the actual development and implementation of these technologies, I don't think much training will be in order

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I mean everyone of our employees knows how to use a wiki, forum blog and chat, and google wave has a extremely friendly interface

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: we don't have to train that much our employees to develop these technologies

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: evrybody can use a chat , forum , bog or something like that

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: People all over the world edit wiki articles easily so that won't be a problem

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes and google wave has a video tutorial that can help our users. So it is a good starting point

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: it could be harder for the chat application, but only for that

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: all we have to do is instruct them on the structure and security policy of our applications

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that is excellenty

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: i totally agree with you

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: any other imporant technologies we should consider?

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: We can also use a SVN for our code. What do you think of this?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I have used it and was very pleased with it

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: also, we can use numerous programs for crypting important data

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: can you say a bit more about this idea?

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: The SVN uses a local server

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: something else, i think, for security resons, we should restrict web access in certain deparments

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: like per say, in the develpment areas

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: A svn is an open-source revision control system. Users can work on a version of the application code and commit it. If two users are working on the same thing when they commit a merge is made with the 2 versions

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: web access? all the access to internet? why?

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I agree. Every employee will have certain privileges depending of their job or department

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: i don't agree because at certaine point everybody will need web for researche or somtething

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: And we can have our own servers, such as an email and SVN

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: else

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: because we are talking about sensitive data that could cost us A LOT

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Maybe not certain employees but certain computers anyway

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: how do you think piracy works? source codes get leacket

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree. People working on different projects don't need access to all of them.

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: that's the last thing we need

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i agree with you on this, everybody needs access to different documentation, we can't provide everything for that

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: you know what they say, the best protection against sharks is not going into the water at all

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I think we have analyzed the most useful technologies around, let's make a short review and that should cover it

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: So you agree with me?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: i do

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i think a svn is a good idea, we should discuss it again in the future

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: the development area should be completely sealed off

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and if somebody needs internet acces, they will have other terminals to use

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: yup

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but what if they need to look up for something?

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes you are right

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: other terminals, computers in the same room even

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: i think it's way to restrictive

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: but the computers used for development should be cut of from the outside world

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: they will use another machine. the restrictions will be only for certain computers

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: this is a better idea then "sealing" a departament

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Ok, so we will use chat and google wave for project and activity management

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: this could make them loose time...

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I agree with you, niot all departments interact

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: yup

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: but if you all think this is the only way to provide the security we need, then i won't complain

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Can you give more details?

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: that is a bit far-fetched, we are talking maybe about a few minutes lost a day

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: quite

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: well...shifting computers for small things

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: You are right we should look at the big picture

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I agree that may be costly, but we will only restrict the access of certain computers

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: they shouldn't need anything from the web, we provide anything they need

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: for every function you don't remember in a programming language, you will have to move to other computer to find out... but it's ok ... it wouldn't be a big problem i guess

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: not necesarly computers,you can change acounts

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: even better. excellent idea

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: on the same computer with different data and internet access

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: we have pros, with years of experience, that shouldn't happen very often

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: and i think it is worth, since it could save us A LOT of money

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: that's true :)

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ok let's sum up.

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: indeed

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: I want everyone to say why their technology should be used

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: so we will use wave and chat for internal affairs such as project management, activity planning and collaboration

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: a wiki will be excellent for summing up the technolgoies / products we use or make

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: well i think chat is important for our employees, it helps them talk and colaborate, spare time by not meeting in conferences that much, and be on track with all theit colleagues are doing

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: A google wave is the best sollution for time and task management. Moreover it can be used for sharing docs, xls, presentations etc

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: ok, and make sure we have a nice-looking site, with a good, well-organised forum, as a first line tech support

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: we should use a blog for posting update and information about products, get opinion from customers and interect with them

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: That is a must have. The way our clients "see" us is most important!

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Indeed. Our companies image will grow if we have a forum, a blog, a wiki and a cool web-site that customers or developers can use

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: and that will also be the blog's function too

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I totally agree. Image is important

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: in these thays, they are more important than the actual products :)

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: and we should use some plubicity for our products.the customers should know about them

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Ok guys and girls I think that covers all the points of our debate

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: so, this was a very productive meeting, i think we settled enough for today :)

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: that can be done in many way, no problem there :)

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: indeed

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: I foresee a very productive year for our company

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: sure hope so

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Hope so too

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: i'm sure all these will improve and help our company grow

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: Guess that wrap's everything up. Have a nice day team

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: see you on the next meeting with new ideas

Data.Author: DaniilConstantin-wiki
Data.Text: leaves the room

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: good night guys, this went quite well

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Yes. Have a nice day too!

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: good night everyone, and thank you for your collaboration:)

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: good night

Data.Author: Andrei Stanciu - forum
Data.Text: leaves the room

Data.Author: Flavius Padina - blog
Data.Text: leaves the room

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Thank you too Ileana for your ideas

Data.Author: BobricIleana - chat
Data.Text: leaves the room

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: Bye

Data.Author: Dragos_Diosteanu-wave
Data.Text: leaves the room
